intro: Polygala suganumae, commonly known as the Saganum polygala, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in China. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its delicate, often pale yellow or greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or open habitats, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually narrow and lance-shaped, and it produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
